## More Information

You can learn more about controlling the appearance of HTML output here: <https://quarto.org/docs/output-formats/html-basics.html>

```{r}
#| label: fig-number-ray
#| fig-cap: "Der Zahlenstrahl"
#| fig-height: 2

# Sample data
x <- rnorm(20)
y <- rnorm(20)
df <- data.frame(x, y)

# Create the plot without the y-axis
ggplot2::ggplot(df, ggplot2::aes(x, y)) +
    ggplot2::geom_point() +
    ggplot_theme +
    ggplot2::theme(
        axis.line.y = ggplot2::element_blank(),
        axis.ticks.y = ggplot2::element_blank(),
        axis.text.y = ggplot2::element_blank(),
        axis.title.y = ggplot2::element_blank()
    )
```
